Leslie Carol Roberts

Editorial Director




Leslie Carol Roberts’ writing focuses on exploration of place, how humans design interactions with the wild, and story, through research and personal story. She has been a Fulbright Fellow in English and Antarctic Studies, a Fulbright Travel Grant recipient, as well as grants from the NEA and others. Her most recent book is Here Is Where I Walk: Episodes from a Life in the Forest, from University of Nevada Press (2019). Her essay, “The Entire Earth and Sky,” was included in the anthology On Nature from Penguin Tarcher and evolved into her first book of the same name, published by University of Nebraska Press. With the designer Jennifer Morla, she edited Morla: On Design (Letterform Archive, 2018.) She is currently working on a book about language, love, and the Antarctic, exploring how environmental activists shaped and reiterated the language of exceptionalism in their fight to save Antarctica.
